description: Let's meet up on Fridays for a cold (artisan) after-work drink, some Real Food appetizers & casual chatting!
name: Farmers' Friday Apéro

description:
Agricovert is a cooperative of 25 small organic producers from Belgium. Together they produce fresh vegetables, fruits, eggs, raw cheese, meat, honey, juice, flour, beer... which they sell at their own farmers' market and distribute via bio baskets in Brussels & Wallony.

On 14th of June they invite us to look behind the scenes of their work and meet the producers.

On the program:

- visit of their premises
- farm visits (by bike!): at 9.30 and 14:00
- farmers market (10:00-14:00)
- animations by local partners (10:00-18:00),
- drinks & food (bar all day long, drink offered at 18:30)
- concert (21:00 +)


Since I volunteered to help them out in the morning, I would have to go there already quite early. But we could meet there at noon, have lunch, look at the activities, do our food shopping at the farmers' market and then participate in the afternoon farm visit (for that you need to bring a bike!). Of course you can also join in at any other point that's convenient for you, but it would be great to make this our first "group" encounter!
how_to_find_us: behind the main station in Gembloux (so it's very easy to go there by train from BXL)
name: Open Doors at farmers' cooperative Agricovert

description: Let's meet up on Fridays for a cold (artisan) after-work drink, some Real Food appetizers & casual chatting!
name: Farmers' Friday Apéro

description:
I invite you to my place for an all-organic Real Food Brunch! I only select really nourishing and yet delicious foods and source all of them directly from small organic farms in Belgium ! On the menu (among others): Raw milk & cheeses, traditional sourdough bread & butter, salad, soup, meat balls, eggs, fruits, yogurt, muesli - my "to-die-for" coconut dessert (if you tell me in advance, I can also adapt for gluten-free, dairy-free, egg-free... ).


I'll be happy to share all of that food with you in a relaxed & cozy atmosphere! Let's talk Real Food (and other things) while enjoying it!
name: All-Organic Real Food Brunch

description:
One of the most important steps you must take if you want to optimize your diet, health & well-being is to get your fats right!
Unfortunately, there is a lot of misinformation circulating, which might be doing you more harm than good.

In this lunch-workshop, I will clear up all confusions you might have around the "fat" topic and invite you to taste & experience the different fats in easy, sometimes surprising, yet always delicious preparations (made with organic ingredients and also suitable for vegetarians). All that shared with a group of nice people in a relaxed setting (in the garden, if the weather allows).

Questions we will answer:

- How much fat do I need?
- Which fats are "good" and which fats are "bad"?
- What are the functions of fat?
- What is the link between fats, hormones & fertility?
- Will eating fat make me fat?
- What is the difference between saturated fat and unsaturated fat?
- What is omega 3 and why is there so much talk about it?
- Is taking fish oil supplements necessary and good for me?
- What criteria to apply when choosing a fat?
- How to use the different fats (to cook in olive oil or not to cook in olive oil...)?

Lunch

During the theoretical part there will be nuts & olives as appetizers.
After the theoretical part, we will put our new knowledge into practice by sharing a lunch including healthy fats (but not only, don't worry ;)):

- Salad with healthy oil (which one will it be??) and nourishing, fatty toppings
- Bread and ... ( butter, margarine or something else???)
- Eggs prepared in different fats so you can taste the difference Also don't miss the chance to enjoy one of my popular, "to-die-for" desserts, containing - you might have guessed by now - lots of healthy fats and only sweetened with real fruit.

When: Saturday, 26th of July from 11:00-13:00
Where: Metabolance, Avenue Milcamps 138, 1030 Brussels
Price: 35 Euro

Since places are limited, please only click "going" if you are really planning to go, since I will keep you a seat!
name: Know your fats (and enjoy them, too!)

description: Let's meet up on Fridays for a cold (artisan) after-work drink & casual chatting!
name: Farmers' Friday Apéro

description:
Lacto-fermented vegetables are one of the forgotten Super Foods!

Naturally rich in probiotics ("good" bacteria) and digestive enzymes, they help digestion and balance the gut flora (and we all know that health starts in the gut - don't we). It's a raw, living product, that gets its amazing health benefits from a natural interaction of the bacteria that naturally are present on the vegetables, whey, salt and time.

Unfortunately, modern supermarkets don't provide traditionally fermented pickles anymore - nowadays they are all canned with vinegar and sugar (or artificial sweeteners) and/or cooked or pasteurized. These processes kill all of the good bacteria or don't allow them to develop in a first place!
Fortunately it is VERY easy to make your own ones - and the advantage is that you can be as creative as you wish to be, working with different vegetables, mixing them up, adding different spices...

During this workshop I will teach you the theoretical basics about lacto-fermented foods and the principle of making them. You will leave with your own jar of cabbage ready to complete the fermentation process in your own kitchen and become delicious, raw sauerkraut!

When: Saturday, 2nd of August, 14:00
Where: Metabolance, Av. Milcamps, 138
Price: 22 Euro (jar and ingredients included)
name: Make your own healthy, raw sauerkraut (or other pickles / fermented veggies)!

description:
Eating out as a Real Foodie is not easy. Fortunately there are more and more organic and/or Slow Food places popping up that use quality ingredients and prepare the food with care - yet are not necessarily more expensive, although they offer so much more value. One of those places is Slow Food Resto "Le Max". They offer quality food (also vegetarian options) at very reasonable prices. I suggest meeting there for dinner, but be informed that they are also very popular for lunch, since they offer a buffet for only 11 Euro and a menu at 14,50. Reservation is obligatory, since they are always full - so please confirm until Friday, 29th, so I can reserve a table in advance. Looking forward to meeting you!

Real Regards,
Claudia
name: Share some good food and talk at Slow Food Restaurant "Le Max"

description:
Dear all,

if I may promote an event I am organizing in the context of Slow Food Goûter Bruxelles:


On Saturday 4th of Oct from 10:00 - 15:00 I organize a small organic market in front of my shop.


Agricovert, cooperative of 25 small organic farmers from Belgium and provider of a huge part of the fresh food you can order every week in my shop, will be there to offer you all kinds of seasonal and local vegetables and fruits, delicious cheeses, butter, yogurt, eggs, bread... and also honey, mustard, beer, juice...


100% grass-fed beef from Belgium and sustainable fish will also be available plus my shop will be open for any supplies of dry foods.


Every hour I will explain the nutritional benefits of raw dairy, traditional sourdough bread, grass-fed beef... there will also be activities for children like face-painting and crafting.


In short, it's all about Real Food and Real People, so you are very warmly invited to join in and bring your friends too! It's a free event. Hope to see you there!

Claudia
name: Organic Market for young and old

description:
Another event I am organizing in the context of Slow Food Goûter Bruxelles:


A talk to challenge the idea that eating meat is always bad for health and the planet.


Eating meat is often blamed to waste precious resources, accelarate climate change and cause health problems. I will explain you under which circumstances eating meat is not at all bad for your health or the planet.
Language: FR/EN

When: Sunday, 5th of October from 14:00-15:30
Where: Metabolance, Avenue Milcamps 138, 1030 Brussels
Price: 8 Euro

Please confirm your presence by reserving your ticket in advance by sending an email to [masked].
name: Eating meat can be healthy and sustainable

description:
Dear all,

I've been quite quiet recently.. sorry for that! I got literally overwhelmed with Real Food (work) ;).

So here's my next Meet Up proposal: Lunch chez Henry & Agnes! Henry & Agnes is a cosy place for organic lunch! They propose either just soup, bread (and optionally cheese), or their "vegetable dish of the day" accompanied by bread and either goat cheese or meat (or nothing). It is close to Schuman, so I hope many of you will be able to make it!

www.henrietagnes.com
name: Lunch chez Henry et Agnes
